page.title: 15BRIDGE END OUTDOOR CENTRE
page.content: THE OLD SCHOOL AT BRIDGE END IS BUILT ALONG WITH THE SCHOOL HOUSE ON A PENINSULA BETWEEN EAST AND WEST BURRA.IT CLOSED 14 YEARS AGO WITH 18 PUPILS.IT LAY EMPTY FOR A NUMBER OF YEARS AND THE COMMUNITY COUNCIL HAD THE IDEA TO TURN IT INTO AN OUTDOOR CENTRE.THE SCHOOL COUNCIL WANTED IT FOR TEACHERS HOUSING.EVENTUALLY THE COMMUNITY COUNCIL GOT THE LEASE OF IT FROM THE EDUCATION COMMITEE FOR A FEW YEARS AND IN COOPERATION WITH SHETLAND ASSOCIATION OF YOUTH CLUBS IT BECAME A TEMPORARY OUTDOOR CENTRE. NO MONEY WAS AVAILABLE AS IT WAS A TEMPORARY LEASE SO IT WAS DONE UP ON A TIGHT BUDGET WITH VOLUNTEERS PAINTING IT AND FURNITURE WAS ACQUIRED FROM THE CAMPS AT SULLOM VOE. AN INDOOR TOILET WAS PUT IN AND IT NOW HAS SIX CANOES AVAILABLE FOR YOUTH GROUPS.
